title: Button (Core) - Usage Examples
description: WordPress core button wrapper with Nexter styling enhancements. Simpler alternative to tp-button (Advanced Button) with essential features.

validationRules.block_id: Required. Unique identifier for the block.
validationRules.btxt: Button text content. HTML source attribute. Can be empty for icon-only (but include for accessibility).
validationRules.bLink: Required link object with url, target ('_self', '_blank'), nofollow ('', 'nofollow').
validationRules.biType: Icon type. Values: 'none' (no icon), 'icon' (Font Awesome), 'image' (uploaded). Default: 'none'.
validationRules.bIcon: Font Awesome icon class (e.g., 'fa fa-arrow-right'). Requires biType: 'icon'.
validationRules.bImg: Uploaded image object with url and Id. Requires biType: 'image'.
validationRules.bipos: Icon order/position. Values: '0' (before text), '1' (after text). Uses CSS order property.
validationRules.bispac: Icon spacing (column-gap between icon and text). Responsive. Recommended: 8-12px.
validationRules.btTypo: Button typography object (font, size, weight, etc.). Standard typography structure.
validationRules.btColor: Button text color. Hex or rgba value.
validationRules.btBg: Button background. Object with openBg, bgType (color/gradient), bgDefaultColor or bgGradient.
validationRules.brad: Border radius. Responsive object with top/right/bottom/left. Creates rounded corners.
validationRules.btPad: Button padding. Responsive object with top/right/bottom/left. Controls button size.

warnings: CRITICAL: Never modify or regenerate block_id - causes blocks to break.
Icon-only buttons should still have btxt for accessibility (screen readers), but can hide with CSS.
biType: 'icon' requires bIcon Font Awesome class. Missing class = no icon appears.
biType: 'image' requires bImg object with valid url and Id. Missing = no icon appears.
bipos uses CSS order: '0' = icon first, '1' = text first. Defaults may vary by browser.
bispac only applies when biType != 'none'. Ignored if no icon.
target: '_blank' should include nofollow: 'nofollow' for external/affiliate links (SEO).
bLink.url required. Empty URL results in non-functional button.
btBg.openBg must be 1 to enable background. Default: 0 (no background).
Gradient backgrounds require bgType: 'gradient' and bgGradient object with gradientColor array.
commonMistakes: Setting biType: 'icon' without providing bIcon (no icon appears)
Setting biType: 'image' without providing bImg object (no icon appears)
Forgetting bisp ac when adding icon (icon smashes against text, no spacing)
Using bipos values other than '0' or '1' (unexpected layout)
Setting btBg properties but leaving openBg: 0 (background doesn't appear)
Using gradient without proper bgGradient structure (falls back to default)
Setting target: '_blank' without nofollow on external links (SEO issue)
Forgetting responsive bAlign (button alignment breaks on mobile)
Using very large brad values with small padding (creates oval/pill shape unintentionally)
bestPractices: Icon spacing: 8-12px (bispac) provides comfortable balance between icon and text
Icon position: bipos '0' (before) for back/download actions, '1' (after) for forward/next actions
Padding: 12-15px vertical, 25-35px horizontal creates standard button size
Border radius: 4-8px for modern rounded look, 20-30px for pill-shaped buttons
External links: always use target: '_blank' AND nofollow: 'nofollow' for SEO
Responsive alignment: center on mobile (xs: 'center'), left/right on desktop
Color contrast: ensure text color has 4.5:1 contrast ratio against background (WCAG AA)
Icon-only buttons: include btxt for screen readers, hide visually with CSS if needed
For phone links: use tel: protocol (e.g., 'tel:+1234567890')
For email links: use mailto: protocol (e.g., 'mailto:email@example.com')
Keep btxt concise (1-3 words) for better mobile display
Test hover states - ensure visual feedback on interaction

layoutContext.parentBlocks: Can be used in any container (tp-container, tp-row/tp-column, tp-container-inner)
layoutContext.siblingBlocks: Often paired with tp-heading, tp-pro-paragraph for CTA sections
layoutContext.alignmentBehavior: bAlign applies text-align to wrapper div, button inherits alignment
layoutContext.iconPositioning: Uses CSS flexbox order property: bipos '0' = order:0 (first), '1' = order:1 (last)
layoutContext.responsiveStrategy: bAlign, bispac, brad, btPad all support responsive (md/sm/xs) breakpoints

performanceConsiderations: Font Awesome icons load from icon font - ensure font loaded for icons to appear
Custom image icons (biType: 'image') require image loading - use small optimized images
Gradient backgrounds are CSS-based - minimal performance impact
Multiple buttons with custom images can impact page load - optimize images
accessibilityNotes: Icon-only buttons should include btxt for screen readers (hidden visually with CSS)
Ensure button text clearly describes action (e.g., 'Download PDF', not just 'Click')
Minimum button size on mobile: 44x44px for touch targets (use btPad to achieve)
Color contrast: ensure btColor vs btBg has 4.5:1 minimum contrast ratio (WCAG AA)
External links (target: '_blank') should indicate 'opens in new tab' for screen readers
Test with keyboard navigation - ensure visible focus state
Don't rely on color alone - use text and icons together to convey meaning

relatedBlocks.tp-button: Advanced button block with more styling options and hover effects
relatedBlocks.tp-heading: Often paired above button in CTA sections
relatedBlocks.tp-pro-paragraph: Often paired above button for context/description
relatedBlocks.tp-image: Often used alongside buttons in feature cards

comparisonWithAdvancedButton.tp-button-core: WordPress core wrapper. Simpler, fewer options. Best for basic buttons with standard styling.
comparisonWithAdvancedButton.tp-button: Advanced custom button. 9 style presets, hover effects, text change on hover, FancyBox support. Best for complex CTAs.
